contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person | name =The Marquis de Montendre | image = | caption = | birth_date =September 1672 | death_date =11 August 1739 (aged 66) | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial = | birth_place = | death_place = | placeofburial_coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline,title}} --> | nickname = | allegiance ={{flag|Kingdom of Great Britain}} | branch =[[British Army]] | serviceyears =1692 - 1739 | rank =[[Field marshal (United Kingdom)|Field Marshal]] | unit = | commands = | battles =[[War of the Spanish Succession]] | awards = | relations = | laterwork = }} [[Field marshal (United Kingdom)|Field Marshal]] '''François de La Rochefoucauld, marquis de Montendre''' ( Doudeauville branch of the Family)(Montendre September 1672 –London 11 August 1739) was a [[Great Britain|British]] soldier, who had left [[France]] as a [[Huguenot]] refugee. He became a [[Field Marshal|field marshal]] in the [[British Army]]. ==Military career== [[Image:LaRochefoucauldMarquis.svg|thumb|left|100px|François de [[Duc de La Rochefoucauld|La Rochefoucauld]], marquis de Montendre]] Born a brother of the 3rd marquis de Montendre and having left [[France]] as a [[Huguenot]] refugee, La Rochefoucauld was [[Commissioned officer|commissioned]] into the [[William III of England|William III]]'s Army in 1692 and given command of Francis du Cambon's Regiment of Foot.<ref>Heathcote, p.99</ref> He served in [[Ireland]] and in the [[Low Countries]].<ref name=heath>Heathcote, p. 100</ref> He inherited his brother's title in 1702.<ref name=heath/> In 1704 he joined the staff of the [[Henri de Massue, Earl of Galway|Earl of Galway]] and fought at the Siege of Badajoz in 1705, the Battle of Alcantara in 1706 and the advance to [[Madrid]] in 1706.<ref name=heath/> Later in 1706 he became [[Colonel (United Kingdom)|Colonel]] of Dungannon's Regiment, and in 1707 he was made [[Commander]] of a Brigade which landed in [[Portugal]].<ref name=heath/> He commanded this brigade at the Battle of Caya in 1709.<ref name=heath/> In 1728 he became [[Master-General of the Ordnance (Ireland)|Master General of the Ordnance in Ireland]] and on 2 July 1739 he was promoted to [[Field marshal (United Kingdom)|field marshal]]; he died later that year.<ref name=heath/> His body lies in Westminster Abbey. His grave has recently been rehabilitated by his descendant, the duke de La Rochefoucauld-Doudeauville (15/01/2013) ==Family== In 1710 he married Mary Anne von Spanheim: they had no children.<ref name=heath/> ==References== {{reflist}} * Heathcote, T.
